<div class="esv"><h2>2 Peter 1</h2>
<div class="esv-text"><h3 id="p61001001.01-1">Greeting</h3>
<p class="chapter-first" id="p61001001.02-1"><span class="chapter-num" id="v61001001-1">1:1&nbsp;</span>Simeon<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f1" id="b1" title="Some manuscripts 'Simon'">[1]</a></span> Peter, a servant<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f2" id="b2" title="Or 'slave'; Greek 'bondservant'">[2]</a></span> and apostle of Jesus Christ,</p>
<p id="p61001001.11-1">To those who have obtained a faith of equal standing with ours by the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ:</p>
 <p class="chapter-first" id="p61001002.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v61001002-1">2&nbsp;</span>May grace and peace be multiplied to you in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.</p>
 <h3 id="p61001003.01-1">Make Your Calling and Election Sure</h3>
<p id="p61001003.07-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v61001003-1">3&nbsp;</span>His divine power has granted to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him who called us to<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f3" id="b3" title="Or 'by'">[3]</a></span> his own glory and excellence,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f4" id="b4" title="Or 'virtue'">[4]</a></span> <span class="verse-num" id="v61001004-1">4&nbsp;</span>by which he has granted to us his precious and very great promises, so that through them you may become partakers of the divine nature, having escaped from the corruption that is in the world because of sinful desire. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001005-1">5&nbsp;</span>For this very reason, make every effort to supplement your faith with virtue,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f5" id="b5" title="Or 'excellence'; twice in this verse">[5]</a></span> and virtue with knowledge, <span class="verse-num" id="v61001006-1">6&nbsp;</span>and knowledge with self-control, and self-control with steadfastness, and steadfastness with godliness, <span class="verse-num" id="v61001007-1">7&nbsp;</span>and godliness with brotherly affection, and brotherly affection with love. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001008-1">8&nbsp;</span>For if these qualities<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f6" id="b6" title="Greek 'these things'; also verses 9, 10, 12">[6]</a></span> are yours and are increasing, they keep you from being ineffective or unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001009-1">9&nbsp;</span>For whoever lacks these qualities is so nearsighted that he is blind, having forgotten that he was cleansed from his former sins. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001010-1">10&nbsp;</span>Therefore, brothers,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f7" id="b7" title="Or 'brothers and sisters'. The plural Greek word 'adelphoi' (translated &quot;brothers&quot;) refers to siblings in a family. In New Testament usage, depending on the context, 'adelphoi' may refer either to men or to both men and women who are siblings (brothers and sisters) in God's family, the church">[7]</a></span> be all the more diligent to make your calling and election sure, for if you practice these qualities you will never fall. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001011-1">11&nbsp;</span>For in this way there will be richly provided for you an entrance into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.</p>
 <p id="p61001012.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v61001012-1">12&nbsp;</span>Therefore I intend always to remind you of these qualities, though you know them and are established in the truth that you have. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001013-1">13&nbsp;</span>I think it right, as long as I am in this body,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f8" id="b8" title="Greek 'tent'; also verse 14">[8]</a></span> to stir you up by way of reminder, <span class="verse-num" id="v61001014-1">14&nbsp;</span>since I know that the putting off of my body will be soon, as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001015-1">15&nbsp;</span>And I will make every effort so that after my departure you may be able at any time to recall these things.</p>
 <h3 id="p61001016.01-1">Christ's Glory and the Prophetic Word</h3>
<p id="p61001016.07-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v61001016-1">16&nbsp;</span>For we did not follow cleverly devised myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses of his majesty. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001017-1">17&nbsp;</span>For when he received honor and glory from God the Father, and the voice was borne to him by the Majestic Glory, &#8220;This is my beloved Son,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f9" id="b9" title="Or 'my Son, my' (or 'the') 'Beloved'">[9]</a></span> with whom I am well pleased,&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v61001018-1">18&nbsp;</span>we ourselves heard this very voice borne from heaven, for we were with him on the holy mountain. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001019-1">19&nbsp;</span>And we have something more sure, the prophetic word, to which you will do well to pay attention as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts, <span class="verse-num" id="v61001020-1">20&nbsp;</span>knowing this first of all, that no prophecy of Scripture comes from someone's own interpretation. <span class="verse-num" id="v61001021-1">21&nbsp;</span>For no prophecy was ever produced by the will of man, but men spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.</p>
</div>
